units.title: Paneth cell differentiation
units.text: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL-22 (2 ng/mL). Culture for 3 days.
units.rationale: This is a step-by-step protocol for inducing Paneth cell differentiation with specific reagents and duration.

units.title: Goblet cell differentiation
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This provides a two-phase protocol with precise reagent changes and timing for goblet cell differentiation.

units.title: Enteroendocrine cell differentiation
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) for 2 days, and then DMH1 (2 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Geﬁtinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This outlines a two-stage differentiation protocol with exact reagent composition and durations for enteroendocrine cells.

units.title: Enterocyte differentiation
units.text: Enterocytes. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), SJ000291942 (10 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), IWR-1 (2 μM) and VPA (0.75 mM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This is a clear, actionable protocol with defined reagents and incubation time for enterocyte differentiation.

units.title: M cell differentiation
units.text: M cells. TNF-α (50 ng/mL) treated for the ﬁrst 4 hours and RANKL (100 ng/mL) for total 3 days.
units.rationale: This specifies a time-sensitive protocol with two distinct treatment phases for M cell induction.

units.title: Crypt isolation and organoid embedding
units.text: Tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidiﬁcation, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol).
units.rationale: This describes a reproducible, stepwise procedure for isolating crypts and initiating organoid culture.

units.title: Organoid dissociation and re-embedding
units.text: Established organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re-embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48-well plate.
units.rationale: This provides a standardized method for passaging organoids with precise cell density and volume.

units.title: EdU cell proliferation assay
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (5-ethynyl-2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour.
units.rationale: This is a direct, actionable protocol for labeling proliferating cells with EdU.

units.title: CRISPR-mediated LGR5 reporter knock-in
units.text: For the construction of a ﬂuorescent reporter, an LGR5-P2A-mNeonGreen knock-in reporter was introduced into the last exon of LGR5 via electroporation, using previously published sgRNA (Supplementary Table 1) and homology arms (Supplementary Table 2). The LGR5 sgRNA plasmids and HDR template were co-electroporated into human intestinal organoids using a NEPA21 electroporator (Nepa Gene) following published methods.
units.rationale: This details a specific genetic engineering protocol with tools, reagents, and methods for reporter integration.

units.title: MBD3 knockdown via CRISPR
units.text: To interfere with MBD3 expression, sgRNA sequences targeting MBD3 were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids and electroporated into established LGR5-mNeonGreen reporter cells. Colonies from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and screened by Western blotting using an MBD3 antibody (1:200, Santa Cruz).
units.rationale: This is a stepwise protocol for gene knockdown using CRISPR and validation via Western blot.
